hero.title: Building clarity into digital products
hero.subtitle: I help founders and product teams shape clear, usable products — from early definition to improving existing systems.

entryPoints.title: Most teams reach me in one of two moments
entryPoints.subtitle: Different stages, same goal: clarity before complexity.

existing.heading: Improve an active product
existing.intro: Your product or MVP is live, or actively being built. Things work, but the UX starts to feel fragile.
existing.outro: This is where I usually step in, bringing structure, clarity, and better UX decisions into an existing system.

building.heading: Define before you design
building.intro: You’re early, but serious. The goal is to make the product clear enough that development can move fast without chaos.

bullets.defineClearly: Define the product clearly before development

building.outro: In these cases, the focus is not on screens yet. It is on defining the product properly from the start.

miniProduct.title: A quick UX perspective on your product or idea
miniProduct.subtitle: Before committing to anything, send me what you have and I’ll reply with 3–4 focused UX observations.

step1.title: You send

items.link: A link to your live product (or a prototype)
items.screens: Screenshots or early designs of the key flow
items.note: A short note: who it’s for, and what users should achieve

step1.footnote: No deck needed. No polishing. Just enough to understand the problem.

step2.title: You get

items.simplify: What I’d simplify or rethink first

step2.calloutText: Just useful feedback you can act on.

miniProduct.footerText: This feedback often helps decide whether refining, rebuilding, or building an MVP makes sense.

strategyPartnership.title: When UX isn’t the first step
strategyPartnership.subtitle: This is only relevant when the product direction isn’t clear yet.
strategyPartnership.intro: Sometimes the challenge isn’t the interface yet. In early or complex situations, teams need clarity around the problem, direction, or business logic before jumping into design.
strategyPartnership.partnershipBody: In these cases, I collaborate with a trusted strategic partner to help define what to build and why. We sharpen your product identity and decision-making framework to ensure the foundation is solid.
strategyPartnership.note: This is optional and only relevant when the product direction isn’t clear yet.

mvpExecution.title: From idea to working MVP
mvpExecution.subtitle: Relevant when teams need something real and usable, not just direction.
mvpExecution.intro: Sometimes teams don’t just need direction; they need something real, fast. When it’s the right fit, I help define the MVP scope, design the UX, and work closely with a trusted developer to turn the concept into a working product.

list.ux: Design the product structure and UX
list.dev: Work closely with a trusted developer
list.mvp: Turn the concept into a working MVP

mvpExecution.boundaryText: I don’t run development teams. I lead the product thinking and UX, collaborating with development to move fast and smart without running a heavy development team.

howIWork.title: How I usually work with teams
howIWork.intro: I work best when UX decisions actually affect the product.

expectations.label: What you can expect
expectations.text: Less noise. More clarity. Decisions that survive real product pressure.

existing.title: Stepping into an existing system
existing.body: Bringing structure and clarity into a product that is already moving.

beforeDev.title: Helping define a product before development
beforeDev.body: Turning ideas into a clear structure so development can move fast without chaos.

mvp.title: Guiding an MVP from idea to something usable
mvp.body: Keeping decisions grounded and making tradeoffs explicit.

howIWork.outro: My role is to reduce uncertainty, keep decisions grounded, and help teams move forward with confidence.

goodFit.title: This is a good fit if:

items.longTermUx: You want UX decisions that hold over time

items.noProductThinking: You want design without product thinking

projects.title: Selected product work
projects.subtitle: A few examples of how I bring structure and clarity into products. Short on fluff, focused on decisions.

cta.title: Not sure what you need yet?
cta.subtitle: Send what you have and I will reply with 3-4 focused UX observations.

keren.quote: I was so impressed with Amir’s original approach, creativity, and manners, that I even had him work on my own brand. Even after our project was done, I still consulted with Amir – my satisfaction was clearly his priority.
keren.name: Keren Rightler

adi.quote: Amir’s ability to communicate ideas visually is truly remarkable. His work is both technically proficient and creatively vibrant.
adi.name: Adi Nudel

about.title: About
about.intro: I’m Amir, a product-focused UX/UI designer.
about.body1: I enjoy working with products in motion – sometimes improving what already exists, sometimes helping teams move from idea to working MVP.

finalCta.title: Not sure where your product stands?
finalCta.line2: We’ll figure out the right next step together.

feedback.title: Send your product or idea
feedback.intro: Share what you have and I will reply with 3-4 focused UX observations. No decks. No sales pitch. Just useful feedback.

message.label: What should I look at?
message.placeholder: Tell me what it is, what is confusing, and what you want to improve.
message.helper: This feedback often helps decide whether refining, rebuilding, or building an MVP makes sense.
